content.raw: Merged due to time. Please make changes as appropriate.
content.html: Merged due to time. Please make changes as appropriate.

update.description:
Courtesy of Hsu airlines.

Requires [this pull request](#!/osrf/gazebo_models/pull-request/153) from Gazebo models.

GUI plugin changes:

* Now, the increments/decrements are based on the current state of the model.
* Roll control.
* Three presets for take-off, cruise and landing.
* Arrow keys control.

Cessna msg changes:

* The message contains the current values observed and the target values commanded by a controller.

LiftDragPluginChanges:

* The plugin now modifies its coeficients based on the angle of the joints. This allows to modify the drag/lift properties when we change the angle of the control surfaces.

Cessna world:

* It contains all the LiftDrag plugins.

[Here's the video](https://youtu.be/iMHGnEhOIhs).

[Tutorial available here](#!/osrf/gazebo_tutorials/pull-request/224).
update.title: Cessna model ready to fly

content.raw: Both flaps are coupled and we use the left one as a reference.
content.html: Both flaps are coupled and we use the left one as a reference.

content.raw: It's an error because the user has requested a particular joint, and the joint is not present.
content.html: It's an error because the user has requested a particular joint, and the joint is not present.

content.raw: Don't put that change into this pull request, but feel free to use it to make a new video.
content.html: Don't put that change into this pull request, but feel free to use it to make a new video.

content.raw: Not sure about it. If <control_joint_name> is not present, we're good. But I would suggest that if <control_joint_name> exists but the joint name is wrong, it's nice to show an error message.
content.html: Not sure about it. If <control_joint_name> is not present, we're good. But I would suggest that if <control_joint_name> exists but the joint name is wrong, it's nice to show an error message.

content.raw: I'm worried about other use cases. Should we change it?
content.html: I'm worried about other use cases. Should we change it?

content.raw: Thanks, 39be3b4
content.html: Thanks, 39be3b4

content.raw:
I took a wild guess here with nice round numbers, but these `<control_joint_rad_to_cl>` values should be the total control surface deflection divide by [Lift_due_to_Elevator_Deflection](https://github.com/tridge/jsbsim/blob/master/aircraft/c172p/c172p.xml#L666).

As far as I can tell, the control surface command range for elevator is defined by [this Elevator Control block](https://github.com/tridge/jsbsim/blob/master/aircraft/c172p/c172p.xml#L245). Looks like it implies the range goes from (-0.4886 to +0.40135)?

Also, we should make it a feature request to add a `<control_joint_rad_to_cd>` using information from [Delta_drag_due_to_flap_deflection](https://github.com/tridge/jsbsim/blob/master/aircraft/c172p/c172p.xml#L464) and [Drag_due_to_Elevator_Deflection](https://github.com/tridge/jsbsim/blob/master/aircraft/c172p/c172p.xml#L522), etc.


Similarly [Pitch_moment_due_to_elevator_deflection](https://github.com/tridge/jsbsim/blob/master/aircraft/c172p/c172p.xml#L808).
content.html:
I took a wild guess here with nice round numbers, but these <control_joint_rad_to_cl> values should be the total control surface deflection divide by Lift_due_to_Elevator_Deflection.

As far as I can tell, the control surface command range for elevator is defined by this Elevator Control block. Looks like it implies the range goes from (-0.4886 to +0.40135)?

Also, we should make it a feature request to add a <control_joint_rad_to_cd> using information from Delta_drag_due_to_flap_deflection and Drag_due_to_Elevator_Deflection, etc.

Similarly Pitch_moment_due_to_elevator_deflection.

content.raw: should be `~/cessna_c172/state`
content.html: should be ~/cessna_c172/state

content.raw: yep, it's fixed, sorry for the noise.
content.html: yep, it's fixed, sorry for the noise.

This makes a better follow mode video:

diff -r 5953dc8f2ebe -r cf672eb60321 gazebo/rendering/Camera.cc
--- a/gazebo/rendering/Camera.cc    Thu May 28 17:23:30 2015 -0700
+++ b/gazebo/rendering/Camera.cc    Fri May 29 10:30:22 2015 -0700
@@ -371,7 +371,9 @@
     this->SetWorldRotation(math::Quaternion(0, currPitch + pitchAdj,
           currYaw + yawAdj));

-    double origDistance = 8.0;
+    /// \TODO: make this a parameter, for larger objects, we want
+    /// to follow it from larger distance.
+    double origDistance = 20.0;
     double distance = direction.GetLength();
     double error = origDistance - distance;

content.raw: this should not be an error, as control joint is not required.
content.html: this should not be an error, as control joint is not required.

content.raw: Thanks
content.html: Thanks

content.raw: I noticed a test failure caused by the previous cessna pull request, fixed in pull request #1716
content.html: I noticed a test failure caused by the previous cessna pull request, fixed in pull request #1716

content.raw: Only the left_flap is being used here? Do we need the right one too?
content.html: Only the left_flap is being used here? Do we need the right one too?

content.raw: Does it happen with the latest version of the code? I think I fixed this problem in 2f43bc1
content.html: Does it happen with the latest version of the code? I think I fixed this problem in 2f43bc1

content.raw:
One bug I found is reproduced by steps below:

  1. start simulation
  1. press `1` to take-off
  1. `gz topic -e /gazebo/default/cessna_c172/state`
  1. observe `cmd_propeller_speed` is 0.8
  1. press `s` key to throttle down
  1. observe `cmd_propeller_speed` changes to 0
content.html:
One bug I found is reproduced by steps below:

  1. start simulation
  2. press 1 to take-off
  3. gz topic -e /gazebo/default/cessna_c172/state
  4. observe cmd_propeller_speed is 0.8
  5. press s key to throttle down
  6. observe cmd_propeller_speed changes to 0

content.raw: Added in 942a8fe
content.html: Added in 942a8fe
